title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

09:23 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <bblfish> has quit  
09:32 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
09:32 <drake01> has quit  
09:40 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: I think you can start using git version of platform now if you don't need web, it's stable enough and there is already several builds in maven.xwiki.org  
09:40 <modulistic> has joined #xwiki  
09:43 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: where exactly can I find the wiki-manager plugin?  
09:57 <+Enygma`> all I see is http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager/ (parent pom) and http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager-ui/ (application)  
09:58 <+Enygma`> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-wiki-manager also seems to only have the UI (application)  
10:00 <+Enygma`> (for my specific need, I`ve switched to only pre-git code (from svn) since I need web. I`ve built the code from svn and am using local repository artifacts until git stabilizes)  
10:07 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: looks like there is something wrong let me check, someone probably forgot some <module>  
10:22 <+tmortagne> and the plugin too  
10:23 <+tmortagne> i did not check wiki manager  
10:24 <+tmortagne> hmm looks like the plugin has not been moved...  
10:24 <+tmortagne> i can see application-manager is here  
10:24 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu probably forgot  
10:25 <+tmortagne> but he is not loged in right now :(  
10:27 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: too bad the only thing you need is the only thing missing it seems  
10:28 <mpaun\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: can you please tell me why (both in svn and git) xwiki-enteprise-manager-parent:3.1 has parent pom xwiki-enteprise-parent:3.0 and not 3.1 ? (snapshots everywhere, ofc)  
10:35 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: was easier that way to shared database stuff and other configurations like that  
10:35 <+tmortagne> s/shared/share/  
10:36 <+tmortagne> hmm wondering new if that's ok with maven release and branch  
10:36 <+tmortagne> s/new/now/  
10:37 <modulistic> has quit  
10:37 <+tmortagne> ha wait  
10:37 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: did not rid correctly :)  
10:37 <+tmortagne> that's an error indeed  
10:38 <+tmortagne> probably a maven branch issue...  
10:38 <+tmortagne> so looks like it's not a very good idea after all  
10:38 <+tmortagne> doing copy/past/...  
10:39 <+Enygma`> where did you do copy/paste?  
10:39 <+tmortagne> i mean fixing the version issue  
10:40 <+Enygma`> ah :)  
10:40 <+tmortagne> fixed on github now  
10:41 <+Enygma`> no commits on svn, right?  
10:41 <+tmortagne> right svn trunk is dead (and read only anyway)  
10:41 <+tmortagne> at first I tough you were talking about the fact that XEM has XE as parent instead of root xwiki pom  
10:41 <+tmortagne> sorry about the confusion  
10:42 <+Enygma`> np, I use xem parent as parent pom for wiki3.0 distro :P  
10:42 <+tmortagne> :)  
10:42 <+Enygma`> I also stumbled upon the annoyin maven limitation of profile DISinheritance  
10:43 <+Enygma`> I wanted to enable by default mysql instead of hsqldb... but I guess I can`t do that without copy/pasting the logic from enteprise pom  
10:44 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: we always build with the database specified in the command line now  
10:44 <+tmortagne> pretty sure there is stuff not working just with the default now  
10:45 <+tmortagne> actually mostly when you build with ci  
10:45 <+tmortagne> because when you enable one profile you break the default  
10:47 <+Enygma`> yes, but for non-xwiki CI builds, it's rather unnatural to have to know that you need to specify the mysql profile (for XEM)... since the maven convention is 'mvn install and you are good to go'  
10:48 <+Enygma`> I was trying to avoid that, but I might go for a build.sh/.bat instead :)  
10:53 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: if you only have mysql build you don't need to copy/past the whole profile logic I think  
10:56 <+tmortagne> just force database related proparties  
10:56 <+tmortagne> ptoperties  
10:56 <+tmortagne> properties  
10:57 <drake01> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <+tmortagne> force=copy/past  
11:03 <+Enygma`> well, I wanted to have hsqldb as secondary. And re db properties, I did not want to duplicate db driver version. Anyway, it's livable :)  
11:03 <+Enygma`> btw, I had a lot of problems while building the svn trunk  
11:04 <+Enygma`> the bigest one was that some projects have (mostly runtime dependencies) set to intervals like [2.7,)  
11:04 <+Enygma`> but I`m building a 3.1-SNAPSHOT and maven does not seem to properly compare versions that are snapshots :)  
11:05 <+Enygma`> or [2.7-milestone-2,) which I`m guessing has the same problem.  
11:05 <+tmortagne> I think that when you don't have SNAPSHOT in an interval maven does not look at SNAPSHOT  
11:06 <+tmortagne> otherwise it would be a mess when releasing  
11:07 <+Enygma`> also, if there is something like dependency version 1.62 and I`ve just built 1.63-SNAPSHOT, maven can't seem to accept the current snapshot.  
11:07 <+tmortagne> not sure what you expect, if the dependency is 1.62 maven is using 1.62 not snapshot  
11:08 <+Enygma`> yes, you are right  
11:08 <+tmortagne> it's a bit strict on versions  
11:08 <+Enygma`> but is it ok if we have all these problems in the SVN trunk?  
11:08 <+Enygma`> I mean we should have at least a building SVN trunk if we still bother on keeping it.  
11:09 <+Enygma`> not to mention all the snapshots coresponsing to the SVN trunk that vanished once hudson got reconfigured (pushing me again to a local build :) )  
11:09 <+tmortagne> what is in trunk is accessible just until we are done with git but only for sources, it does not have to work  
11:09 <+tmortagne> it's like we had refactored on svn directly  
11:10 <+tmortagne> you would not try to build from an older svn revision and expect it to work properly  
11:11 <+tmortagne> but I agree it's a bit confusing right now  
11:11 <+tmortagne> which is why we want to hide svn as soon as git is fully ready  
11:12 <+Enygma`> I`d rather say hide the trunk but keep the tags for source reference / older deployments  
11:12 <+tmortagne> theses are supposed to be in git too  
11:12 <+Enygma`> ah, ok then, even better :)  
11:13 <+Enygma`> do you have a (veeery loose) ETA for the git transition stabilisation?  
11:16 <+tmortagne> if you except contrib stuff it's supposed to be already done actually, wiki-manager has just been forgotten but we will have to wait for sdumitriu for it because I have no idea how it moved plugin properly from one repo to another  
11:17 <+Enygma`> ah, so XEM will be building successfully after this?  
11:17 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:18 <+Enygma`> cool  
11:18 <+Enygma`> too bad I waisted ages building the svn trunk, but it's all for a good cause :D  
11:18 <chanikag> has joined #xwiki  
11:18 <+tmortagne> I just commented  buildnumber stuff in web-standard for it to build properly untill I find a fix for git so XE will build quickly after that  
11:18 <+tmortagne> so we should have a jenkins all blue today  
11:19 <+tmortagne> well blue or orange :)  
11:19 <+tmortagne> not red anyway :P  
11:19 <+Enygma`> :)

14:00 <abusenius> has quit  
14:03 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : can you give me a secound i just switched to windows have to switch back  
14:04 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
14:06 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
14:07 <@cjdelisle> heh sorry for making you switch operating systems, I thought you had it right there.  
14:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: np  
14:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle:http://pastebin.com/qnYUPT6i  
14:09 <pulasthi> i tried replacing the jars maually didnt work  
14:10 <@cjdelisle> ahh, flakey github based maven repo  
14:10 <pulasthi> what can i do ?  
14:10 <@cjdelisle> todo start a free maven repo  
14:11 <@cjdelisle> yea, that'd be a great idea, get some boxen and setup a free to use maven repo ;)  
14:11 <@cjdelisle> lemme see if I can repeat it  
14:11 <pulasthi> ok  
14:13 <@cjdelisle> hrm  
14:13 <@cjdelisle> you connected to http://github when the pom file said https://github  
14:14 <@cjdelisle> I wonder why that would happen  
14:14 <pulasthi> :-/  
14:15 <@cjdelisle> do you have a fast internet connection?  
14:15 <@cjdelisle> like > 1Mb/s  
14:15 <pulasthi> nope  
14:16 <pulasthi> 512 connection  
14:16 <pulasthi> does it have to do with the connection  
14:17 <@cjdelisle> have you built the xwiki core yet?  
14:17 <mpaun\_> has quit  
14:17 <@cjdelisle> (compiled)  
14:17 <mpaun\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:17 <pulasthi> no i did'nt do that  
14:17 <pulasthi> should i do it fisrt  
14:18 <@cjdelisle> The reason I asked is because maven stores everything it downloads which xwiki core pulls in so many libraries that it ends up being like 100MB  
14:19 <@cjdelisle> easy way to set maven back to zero is to delete the local store, I just did that.  
14:19 <pulasthi> well i had some trouble with my previuos ubuntu instalation  
14:20 <pulasthi> i did smthing nasty and had to re install  
14:20 <@cjdelisle> Sometimes a bad download leads to bad stuff in the local store, easy solution is delete it.  
14:20 <pulasthi> this was the first biuld i did after completely intalling ubuntu 11.04  
14:20 <pulasthi> :D  
14:22 <@cjdelisle> I just wiped my local repo, building now...  
14:23 <@cjdelisle> wow maven downloads a ton of crap  
14:23 <@cjdelisle> (for this tiny build)  
14:23 <pulasthi> :D  
14:23 <pulasthi> ya  
14:25 <@cjdelisle> kind of annoying that it doesn't download pom files in parallel  
14:25 <@cjdelisle> should have like 50 sockets open at once  
14:27 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: https://github.com/tnine/m2repo/raw/master  
14:27 <pulasthi> it gives xml that has http:  
14:29 <@cjdelisle> [INFO] BUILD SUCCESS  
14:29 <@cjdelisle> mmmkay  
14:30 <pulasthi> ohhh i should delete the repo and try again  
14:30 <pulasthi> :(  
14:30 <@cjdelisle> yea then paste the entire output from beginning to end  
14:31 <@cjdelisle> seems like your system is connecting to http://github when it should be connecting to https://github  
14:33 <pulasthi> did u check the link i gave  
14:39 <qwebirc33659> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: it says to add a part to the pom but it specifiers a http: address  
14:40 <bblfish> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <qwebirc33659> Hi guys, I am having trouble with the LDAP configuration on windows server 2008 - when trying to log in with my username, i get ERROR web.XWikiAction - Connection aborted  
14:46 <qwebirc33659> xwiki.authentication.ldap.base\_DN=DC=XY,DC=XYZ xwiki.authentication.ldap.bind\_DN=domain\XYZ xwiki.authentication.ldap.bind\_pass=XYZ xwiki.authentication.ldap.validate\_password=1 xwiki.authentication.ldap.UID\_attr=name  
14:47 <qwebirc33659> xwiki.authentication.ldap.fields\_mapping=name=name,last\_name=sn,first\_name=givenName,fullname=displayName,email=mail,ldap\_dn=dn  
14:48 <@cjdelisle> pulasthi: which link?  
14:48 <pulasthi> https://github.com/tnine/m2repo/raw/master  
14:49 <@cjdelisle> ahh, I think that's incorrect, github gets mad if you try to connect without ssl  
14:49 <pulasthi> anyway im erased the repo and biulding again  
14:49 <pulasthi> :)  
14:49 <@cjdelisle> Cool. Paste everything.  
14:50 <@cjdelisle> I think you also have a .m2/repository directory under /root/  
14:51 <pulasthi> yep got rid of that too  
14:52 <+tmortagne> qwebirc33659: did you try to enable debug log ? it's usually the easiest to quickly see what's wrong in the configuration  
14:55 <bblfish> has quit  
15:03 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: did you seen my message on skype ?  
15:04 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
15:04 <pulasthi> cjdelisle:  hi got some other error this can be occurs because there is a missing </hr> in the xml  
15:04 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: :http://pastebin.com/Zd00MmTP  
15:04 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: ok never sure with skype, looks like the new version works well so far  
15:07 <@cjdelisle> It might just be me but that paste has the distinct look of being abridged  
15:07 <+sburjan> what version do you have tmortagne ?  
15:07 <+tmortagne> 2.2.0.25  
15:07 <+tmortagne> new beta version  
15:08 <+tmortagne> had lot of freeze with the previous one  
15:08 <+sburjan> ok, I'm gonna update too  
15:08 <+sburjan> hope I won't loose my logs  
15:08 <+tmortagne> nop you keep them  
15:08 <+tmortagne> I did at least  
15:08 <+tmortagne> sburjan: what linux are you using ?  
15:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: didnt get you there?  
15:08 <+tmortagne> it's supposed to be already in ubuntu repositories  
15:09 <@cjdelisle> can you paste everything between "mvn clean install" and the next command line?  
15:09 <+sburjan> tmortagne: 40.04 ..  
15:09 <+sburjan> tmortagne: 10.04 ..  
15:09 <+tmortagne> ha ok  
15:09 <+tmortagne> so yes you will not get new skupe automatically probably  
15:09 <+tmortagne> why don't you use 10.10 ?  
15:09 <+sburjan> only if I put the 10.10 universe repos maybe  
15:10 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ahh that error can be dealt with easily the problem is why is it only me getting the error  
15:10 <+sburjan> this one is satble, and I don't see any improvement in ubuntu since 8.x ... except the interface :)  
15:10 <pulasthi> :-/  
15:10 <+tmortagne> sburjan: it's on canonical partners repo actually i think  
15:10 <+tmortagne> not universe  
15:11 <+sburjan> I see  
15:11 <+tmortagne> sburjan: well you have all the applications updates  
15:11 <+tmortagne> it's not only about ubuntu itself  
15:12 <+sburjan> tmortagne: one day i'll dist-upgrade :)  
15:12 <+tmortagne> you can wait for 11.04 ;)  
15:12 <+sburjan> yepp, that's what I'm doing  
15:12 <+tmortagne> should be released soon i guess  
15:12 <+sburjan> Im curiious abut its new interface  
15:13 <+tmortagne> yep me too but a bit scared too  
15:13 <+sburjan> a lot of people say it's gonna be #fail :)  
15:13 <+sburjan> and you'll have to manually switch back to gnome or kde  
15:13 <@sdumitriu> Still using Ubuntu?  
15:13 <+sburjan> well ... I don't 3 days to install Gentoo :P  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> Each new version is a PITA to upgrade, and they change everything, you'd have to learn the new UI all over again  
15:14 <+tmortagne> yes but it's fun to get new stuff :)  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> I get new stuff every day  
15:14 <+sburjan> I heart that the Gnome guys rewrote the core in the past years, and Gnome has greatly improved.. and now Ubuntu is dropping Gnome as default DM :)  
15:14 <+sburjan> \*heard  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> I don't have to wait for the next release to get new versions of programs  
15:15 <+tmortagne> i guess a ubuntu distro with gnome will be released like kubuntu  
15:15 <+tmortagne> gubuntu :)  
15:15 <+sburjan> maybe :)  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> Gnome is getting too lame, same as Ubuntu  
15:15 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: for most of major program there is alternate repository with last versions  
15:15 <@sdumitriu> They remove all configuration  
15:16 <+tmortagne> and I'm too lazy right now to try another system :)  
15:16 <+sburjan> tmortagne: yes, that repo feature is very cool if you know how to take advantage :)  
15:27 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: got the error again  
15:27 <pulasthi> cjdelisle:http://pastebin.com/MtvwAa8j  
15:27 <+sburjan> tmortagne: indeed, skype is more faster and responsive  
15:29 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: its missing a bit from the top :) i forgot to put scrolling to unlimited  
15:42 <qwebirc33659> ok, enabled debug. got this: DEBUG ldap.XWikiLDAPConnection - LDAP search found attributes: [{name=dn value=DC=XYZ,DC=com}, {name=name value=XYZ}, {name=objectClass value=top}, {name=objectClass value=domain}, {name=objectClass value=domainDNS}] DEBUG ldap.XWikiLDAPUtils - Found group [DC=XYZ,DC=com] members :null DEBUG LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl   - Local LDAP authentication failed. com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 80  
15:42 <qwebirc33659> =com.         at om.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl.ldapAuthenticateInContext XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl.java:339)  
15:44 <+tmortagne> qwebirc33659: could you put the whole thing on http://pastebin.com/ ?  
15:48 <qwebirc33659> voila: http://pastebin.com/w4Pumj6W  
15:49 <+tmortagne> so you  issue seems to be "LDAP user Mueller Isabel does not belong to LDAP group DC=leister,DC=com."  
15:49 <+tmortagne> you are trying to authenticate with a user which does not belong to the allowed group i think  
15:50 <+tmortagne> DC=leister,DC=com does not looks like a group actually  
15:50 <qwebirc33659> but it does, i was checking with active directory explorer  
15:50 <qwebirc33659> no?  
15:50 <+tmortagne> a group is an LDAP entry  
15:50 <+tmortagne> not a base DN  
15:51 <+tmortagne> basically what XWiki calls group in LDAP is an entry listing explicitely some users  
15:51 <+tmortagne> using their DN or uid  
15:51 <+tmortagne> do you really need to filter users ?  
15:52 <+tmortagne> DC=leister,DC=com looks more like a base DN to me, what you put in xwiki.authentication.ldap.base\_DN  
15:52 <qwebirc33659> no, not really, probaly it's my lack of experiance with ldap  
15:52 <+tmortagne> in that case keep xwiki.authentication.ldap.user\_group commented  
15:53 <qwebirc33659> ok, i'll try that... brb  
15:53 <+tmortagne> or coment it back in your case  
15:54 <supreet> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <qwebirc33659> ok, this kind of helped. LDAP seems to find me now in the LDAP. but: LDAP authentication failed: could not validate the password: wrong password for CN=XYZ  
16:00 <qwebirc33659> the password is correct, i swear  
16:00 <qwebirc33659> could a \* in the password cause this?  
16:01 <+tmortagne> qwebirc33659: did you enabled xwiki.authentication.ldap.validate\_password ?
